The '''Jackson State Tigers''' represent [[Jackson State University]] in [[NCAA]] intercollegiate athletics.
==Conference affiliation== Jackson State University's athletic teams participate in the [[Southwestern Athletic Conference]] (SWAC) which is a part of the [[NCAA]] Division I. Football participates in the [[Football Championship Subdivision]] (formerly Division I-AA). Jackson State University's colors are [[royal blue]] and [[white]] and their nickname is the [[Tiger]].
==Sports== ===Football=== ====Capital City Classic==== Every [[Thanksgiving]] weekend, Jackson State plays rival [[Alcorn State University]] in the Capital City Classic at [[Mississippi Veterans Memorial Stadium|Veterans Memorial Stadium]] in Jackson, MS. Every year, the Tigers play their archrival [[Southern Jaguars|Southern University]] in the "[[Boombox Classic]]". Every year, the Tigers take part in the annual [[Southern Heritage Classic]] against the [[Tennessee State Tigers]]. In 2007, the Tigers defeated the Tigers of [[Grambling State University]] 42-31 to lock up the 2007 [[Southwestern Athletic Conference|SWAC]] [[SWAC Championship Game|Championship]].
